summary:
Lithium is a soft, silvery-white metal with the symbol Li. It's the least dense metal and solid element. Lithium is very reactive and must be stored carefully. It doesn't occur naturally in its pure form but is found in minerals and ocean water. People make lithium metal by using electricity to separate it from other elements.

Lithium is important in many industries. It's used to make special glass, lubricants, and batteries. It's also used in medicine to help with mood disorders. Lithium is even used in nuclear physics because of its unique properties.
title: Lithium
